resources.string: Please make sure the device WIFI and GPS services are on
Error: Not Connected to a network, please connect the continue
Please turn on the device wifi on to be able to connect to the captive portal network
Please complete the checklist then press continue
"We couldn't find any networks with no password which is usually the "
case with captive portals. Please connect manually to Network.
Device Cellular data is turned off
Once all the three steps are completed, please click the continue button.
Couldn\'t detect captive portal url, are you sure the current network has a captive portal?
Trying to detect captive portal login page

-Please complete the login steps to the captive portal. If you found privacy policy link, please view it. Then click end analysis from top menu. \n-If website is not loading properly, try the switch button.

This app was created to study the behavior of captive portals, analyze their vulnerabilities, and evaluate whether they respect user privacy. It also examines depth of information they require from users.
Â© 2024 Captive Portal Analyzer. All rights reserved.
App couldn\'t find any open networks.
Please proceed to next step to start the analysis.\n
Location permission is required to analyze captive networks. please enable from app settings
Location permission is required, app needs to know your location to detect nearby Wi-Fi networks and to check the network\'s status.
Access Fine Location - Required to detect Wi-Fi networks accurately.
Access Coarse Location - Required to detect nearby Wi-Fi networks.
Access Network State - Required to check the network\'s status.
Access Wi-Fi State - Required to monitor the Wi-Fi network\'s status.
Change Wi-Fi State - Required to manage Wi-Fi connections.
Internet Access - Required to connect to the internet.
Change Network State - Required to manage network configurations.
The following permissions are required for the app to function properly:
Please grant these permissions to continue.
It looks like you still have no full internet connection, please complete the login process of the captive portal before stopping the analysis.
Failed to get network unique modifier
We couldn\'t find any saved interactions with captive portals generated from the app, please try again later.
Welcome! Thank you for helping make the internet safer. Start a session to generate a report on the nearest captive portal for analysis.
If you have an issue connecting to network automatically please click the button to try manual connection.
This app is designed to assist in the collection of data related to captive portals, with the aim of enhancing user security and ensuring data privacy.
Start by creating a session and login to your network with a captive portal. We\'ll guide you step by step.
Are you sure current network has a captive portal?
Please login into the captive portal through the app then click the End Analysis button.

"We wanted to create a database of different captive portals and which data they collect from users and what privacy rules they have to help in the research field of privacy and security of WLAN networks in the "
1- Connect to a network with a captive portal\n
2- Interact with as many pages as possible within the captive login site inside the app\n
3- View the captive portal privacy policy and Terms of Service (ToS) if found\n
4- Complete login to the captive portal\n
5- Review and upload the session data for more analysis
After you successfully create a session, it is only stored on your device and won\'t be shared with us until you review the content and approve the upload from the sessions page.
What data will I share with you?
If website is not loading properly, please try to the switch button.
Please proceed to connect to network manually
Please tap images with privacy policy or terms of service to mark them.

-Feel free to review collected data \n-Please mark screenshots containing privacy policy or terms of service related data through the button below \n-Last step is to upload the collected data so we can further analyze it.

- This provides a preliminary overview of the captive network, comprehensive analysis will be conducted by our researchers once you upload the session data for review.
Here is what AI found about the network:
- Make sure you are connected to internet.
How to create correctly inspect network?
Please select the network with captive portal
This seems to be either a normal network with no captive portal or captive portal network after access to internet
Needed permissions for application functionality not granted.
The app needs approximate location & network permissions to work properly, please allow permissions
The permissions are essential for the app to function properly and won\'t work otherwise, we need access to WiFi and location to connect to captive portal networks
No internet connection detected. Please check your network settings and try again.
Connection timed out while trying to load the captive portal. Please try again.
Network error occurred while loading the captive portal. Please check your connection and try again.
Permission denied. Please grant the required network permissions and try again.
An unexpected error occurred. Please restart the app and try again.
Required permissions were denied. Please grant the permissions in settings.
App will try to recreate the HTML content that was extracted from the page you selected
This can fail if some needed component of the page are missing
Tap card to view the HTML content exracted from page
Tap card to view the full request content
Thanks for uploading network data for further analysis.
Please review and upload collected data to help us research this network.
This session was created in the last %1$s minutes.
Please try backup Webview if website fails to load by clicking \"Switch browser\"
Please use this Webview only if website fails to load in original Web, otherwise please \"Switch browser\" again

Please enter a prompt and press the \"Analyze\" button to start.
Please complete following steps to enable TLS decryption
A new mitm addon update is available. Update to get the latest bug fixes
The PCAPdroid mitm addon must be updated
Bad PCAPdroid mitm addon version. Please install version %1$s and retry
No app found to perform this action
Install the PCAPdroid CA certificate, choosing \"VPN and apps\". Android will ask for your lockscreen or password
Export the PCAPdroid CA certificate, then open the Android \"Encryption & Credentials\" settings and choose install it as a \"CA certificate\"
Certificate exported, now install it from the Android settings
Connection to the mitm addon failed. As a workaround, you can try to open the mitm addon app and then go back to PCAPdroid without closing it. Do you want to open it now?
An error occurred while exporting the CA certificate\n\nIf your device implements Autostart or similar software to limit background services execution, be sure to whitelist PCAPdroid
The mitm certificate does not seem to be installed. If you proceed, decryption may fail
Please complete the following steps to enable TLS Decryption
Storage permission is required so that app is able to store result as PCAP file
The app uses notifications to send traffic tracking updates.
Allow app to store PCAP files to device
VPN permission is required for network traffic monitoring
Waiting for the active VPN to disconnectâ¦
Could not set up the VPN. Ensure that Always-on VPN is disabled

PCAPdroid simulates a VPN in order to capture the network traffic without root.

To start the capture, you need to accept the VPN request in the next screen.

NOTE: to proceed, disable any configured Always-on VPN from the Android settings
\"Unknown\" marks connections whose app could not be determined
System daemons running with maximum privileges
The system daemon performing the DNS resolutions
Could not start the mitm service. Try to open the mitm addon app manually and retry
The CA certificate is not installed, run the mitm setup wizard
Battery optimization may interfere with the mitm addon
The external storage permission is required
Write to external storage failed. Check the app log for details
No app found to handle file selection
To use country-based firewall rules, download the geolocation database from the PCAPdroid settings, otherwise country-based rules will be ineffective
The connection to Google Play is in progress, please retry in a while
User-defined whitelist to inhibit malware detection. Long-press malicious connections to create rules unmarking them as malware
List of rules to hide connection-list entries so you can focus on relevant ones
The %1$s app has been blocked by the firewall
Detect connections to known malicious hosts via third-party blacklists
Private DNS prevents PCAPdroid from inspecting the DNS traffic. You can turn it off from the Android network settings
The full payload option has been disabled
The app is running out of memory, expect crashes
Could not open the capture interface
The file has an unsupported datalink
The specified file does not exist
Capture start failure. Ensure that the device is rooted with Magisk
Capture start failure. Make sure you grant root access to PCAPdroid
Error reading the capture file. Check the log for details
A connection from app \"%1$s\" triggered a malware detection rule (%2$s)
